newsitem.title: USA: Ford Motor Co Q4 net rises.
newsitem.headline: Ford Motor Co Q4 net rises.

text.p: Shr primary $1.00 $0.49
Shr diluted 0.99 0.48
Avg shrs diluted 1,187,000 1,136,000
(All data above 000s except per share numbers)

NOTE: 1996 Q4 includes net charges of $132 million, or $0.11 per fully diluted share, which consist of a $336 million charge for voluntary employee separations and $204 million gain from partial reversal of previous writeoff of loans to Budget Rent a Car Corp.

1995 Q4 includes net one-time gains of $101 million, or $0.02 per fully diluted share. That consists of a $129 million charge for employee separation programs and a $230 million gain from dissolution of Autolatina joint venture with Volkswagen AG. Per share amount of gain cut $0.06 by associated preferred stock exchange.
YEAR
Shr primary $3.65 $3.34
Shr diluted 3.64 3.33
Avg shrs diluted 1,179,000 1,071,000
(All data above 000s except per share numbers)

NOTE: 1996 year includes net gains of $76 million, including $436 million charge for employee separations, a $233 million net writedown of Budget loans, and one-time gains of $650 million from sale of stock in Associates First Capital Corp and $95 million from sale of USL Capital assets.
1995 year includes one-time gain of $84 million, consisting of a $146 million charge for employee separations, and a $230 million gain from Autolatina dissolution.
Q4 U.S. automotive profit $628 million vs profit $168 million. 1996 full-year U.S. automotive profit was $2 billion vs profit $1.8 billion
Q4 non-U.S. automotive loss $238 million vs loss $152 million. 1996 full-year non-U.S. automotive loss $352 million vs profit $213 million.
Q4 European automotive loss $88 million vs loss $48 million. 1996 full-year European loss $291 million vs profit $116 million.
Q4 South American automotive loss $287 million vs loss $112 million. 1996 full-year South American loss $642 million vs loss $94 million.

Q4 Financial Services Group profits $814 million, including gain from partial Budget writeoff reversal, versus $644 million. 1996 full-year Financial Services Group profits $2.79 billion vs $2.08 billion.
Q4 Ford Credit profit $385 million vs $455 million. 1996 full-year Ford Credit profit $1.44 billion vs $1.58 billion.
Q4 worldwide vehicle unit sales 1,753,000 vs 1,590,000. 1996 full-year worldwide vehicle sales 6,653 vs 6,606.
1996 year-end automotive cash, marketable securities $15.41 billion vs $12.41 billion.

In a statement, Ford Chairman Alex Trotman said he expects improved automotive earnings in 1997, including better results in Europe. "We have a tough business plan in place," he said. We expect automotive earnings to improve in 1997, driven by a strong product-lineup and company-wide efforts to lower costs."
